meanings.definition: (Latin) to spoil, destroy; to corrupt, seduce, bribe
meanings.english_definition: (Latin) to spoil, destroy; to corrupt, seduce, bribe.

examples.translation: Money corrupts morals. (お金は道徳を腐敗させる。)

etymology.value: From com- (intensive prefix) + rumpo (“I break, burst”).

verb_forms.present_active_indicative: corrumpō, corrumpis, corrumpit, corrumpimus, corrumpitis, corrumpunt
verb_forms.imperfect_active_indicative: corrumpēbam, corrumpēbās, corrumpēbat, corrumpēbāmus, corrumpēbātis, corrumpēbant
verb_forms.future_active_indicative: corrumpam, corrumpēs, corrumpet, corrumpēmus, corrumpētis, corrumpent
verb_forms.perfect_active_indicative: corrupī, corrupistī, corrupit, corrupimus, corrupistis, corruperunt
verb_forms.pluperfect_active_indicative: corruperam, corruperās, corruperat, corruperamus, corruperatis, corruperant
verb_forms.future_perfect_active_indicative: corrupero, corruperis, corruperit, corruperimus, corruperitis, corruperint

usage_notes.explanation: corrumpo is a Latin verb with a range of meanings related to spoiling, destroying, or corrupting something. It can refer to physical destruction, moral corruption, or the act of bribing someone.

readability_explanation.text: This is a Latin word, so readability depends on the reader's familiarity with Latin.
